scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of four letters to Peyton Short (1915- ) and one undated biographical pamphlet describing his career. One letter from President Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), December 29, 1939, responds to Short's "suggestion of safeguarding and promoting democratic ideals through the medium of organized local clubs interested in combating the spread of anti-democratic propaganda," by a cautious word of approval coupled with a warning against linking such a program directly to the Government of the United States.

Two letters, one from President Ramon Magsaysay (1907-1957) of the Philippines, July 9, 1956, and one from Lim Yew Hock, Chief Minister of Singapore, July, 11, 1956, both discuss the work of the World University Service among the student community of the world. Mr. Short was Regional Secretary of the Southwestern and Rocky Mountain Regions for the World University Services and in 1956 he made a world tour on behalf of the students of America, where he met many Asian leaders.
Also present is a photostatic copy of a letter from Edgar Whitehead, Prime Minister of Southern Rhodesia, June 15, 1960, praising Short's work with the Commonwealth Society for the Deaf.
